intro: Bilabrella linguiformis, commonly known as the tongue-shaped bilabrella, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive tongue-shaped leaves, which are typically broad and flat. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
